response.overview: In 18th century France, a gifted young sculptor becomes consumed by his pursuit of artistic greatness. As ambition tightens its grip, the love and tenderness that once grounded him begin to fracture. Especially the bond with his mother, the one soul who sees beyond his genius.  Torn between devotion and obsession, he must confront a haunting question: is true greatness worth the cost of love?  Sculpting the Soul is a poetic meditation on art, sacrifice, and the quiet wounds left behind in the pursuit of immortality.
response.tagline: Is true greatness worth the cost of love?
response.title: Sculpting the Soul
